Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a large red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is thickly coated with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now very smudged, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.205)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36492) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36492)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 356 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
